(Mar 2021)", "", "At first glance, Colony looks like yet another hotel buffet restaurant, but a clever hand with the interior blends the nostalgia of a bygone British-colonial era with more modern trappings. Partitions, vintage furnishings, and a smattering of tartan and houndstooth prints provide the charm, but it\u2019s the impressive gastronomic journey that will keep you coming back for more.\nThe seven kitchens and accompanying 'live cooking stations' highlight the best of local cuisines and include Chinese, Indian, Indonesian, Malaysian, and Western dishes. You'll be inundated with choice - fresh seafood, perfectly grilled meats, laksa and other signature Singaporean dishes, dim sum, breads baked the traditional Tandoor way, and a wide variety of pastries and desserts. Wash it all down with refreshing juices or seek out Colony's resident mixologist to whip up specialty cocktails like the \"Bengal Brew\" or the \"Governor's Invitation\". Diners looking for buffet options that cover the expansive culinary heritage of Singapore will not be disappointed. (Nov 2016)", "From the folks that brought you Lunar Coffee Brewers and Atlas Coffeehouse, comes this classy addition to the Upper Thomson cafe strip. Named after the great explorer Christopher Columbus, this sizeable spot serves up dishes inspired by a range of cuisines - this is not your usual cafe fare.\n\nThe Soft-Shell Crab Burger is a crowd favourite, and for good reason. Fluffy brioche buns encase a crisp deep-fried soft shell crab patty topped with delicious furikake eggs and caramelised onions. The curly fries on the side go perfectly with the rich burger. Another popular, albeit lighter, option is the Salmon Soba Noodles. Made with poached salmon, bouncy soba noodles, and topped with cilantro-lime nori yogurt, this dish is tangy, gentle on the palate, and won\u2019t undo any diet plans you may have. For something a little sweeter, opt for the Candied Bacon Buttermilk Waffle, a soft waffle served with bacon that has been tossed in sugar - the unique sweet and salty flavour combined with the tenderness of the waffle makes for a delicious and memorable dish.\n\nCafe junkies after their caffeine fix will be glad to know that Columbus offers specialty coffee from local roasters Two Degrees North. From a smooth latte to a sophisticated v60 filter brew,  the rigorous standards and consistency held by the team is the foundation of their success.  (Oct 2018)", "Feast on a spread of classic Mexican favourites at Comida Mexicana! In a sign of the restaurant\u2019s dedication to authenticity and quality, the dishes served are made from scratch using fresh ingredients imported directly from Mexico and the US. Expect dishes that are as much a feast for the eyes as they are for the stomach \u2013 vibrant colours abound in lip-smacking creations such as the Chipotle Sweet Potato Bowl.\n\nStart off with a serving of Chile Con Queso, an addictive combination of jalapenos, melted red cheddar and jack cheese, as well as onions and tomatoes. This one will tickle your taste-buds and get your appetite all whetted and raring to go. For your main, you can\u2019t go wrong with a good helping of Carnitas, or traditional Mexican pulled pork. This yummy dish comes with warm corn tortillas, salsa rojas, salsa verde, and guacamole \u2013 a real scrumptious option that\u2019s worth every cent, if you ask us. Finish off on a high note when you scarf down a sweet treat such as the Kahlua Tiramisu, which gives a distinctively Mexican twist to this beloved Italian classic. Strong in flavour and extremely indulgent, there are few better ways to end your meal. If you\u2019re up for good Mexican grub, Comida Mexicana is the place to visit. (Nov 2017)", "Have you met Stan? The man of the people, Stan is a no-nonsense straight-talker who champions good coffee done right. That\u2019s the promise behind the unpretentious cafe Common Man Stan, located in the heart of the Central Business District, and boy has the establishment succeeded at delivering what it set out to do.  \n\nBrought to you by the people behind Common Man Coffee Roasters, Common Man Stan is a mecca for those who love their cups of joe. Aside from turning out Instagram-worthy cups of espresso, Common Man Stan also boasts cutting edge brewing gear and tapped in nitro cold brew and tea! \n\nWhether you\u2019re an early riser who prefers to kickstart the day with a hearty breakfast or a late owl who crawled out of bed just in time for lunch, Common Man Stan has you covered.  Have your pick with a freshly made New York Bagel topped with herb garlic or sun-dried tomato cream cheese. We also can\u2019t get enough of droolsome Potato & Leek Rosti, which is perfectly paired with wild mushrooms, gruyere and chilli poached eggs on toast. So if you\u2019re in need of a midday caffeine boost or a scrumptious meal, swing on down to Common Man Stan. (Jan 2018)", "Sharing its space with Stage Music Bar, this spot is a coffeehouse by day and live music venue at night. Founded with the aim of giving communities a free space to meet and mingle, this casual joint in the heart of the city is perfect for everything, from casual weekend brunches to serious business meetings. Serving coffee approved by the Specialty Coffee Association, the brews here are sure to impress connoisseurs.\r\n\r\nHeading here for breakfast? Brave the Pancake Tower, a pile of thick, fluffy pancakes topped with a range of ingredients, such as fruit and crumbled cookies. Seafood lovers can opt for the Crab Wrap, a tortilla wrap filled with mesclun salad and a generous portion of lightly sweet crab meat. For something a little moreish, be sure to try the Chicken Aglio Olio, a light dish of linguine topped with smoky grilled chicken and seasoned with chilli flakes. Lightly spicy, flavourful, and filling, this is a great option for lunch. Watching your waistline? The Spanish Flying Fish might be what you need. Light barramundi is fried to crisp perfection and served with searing pico de gallo and salsa. (Oct 2019)", "Established around the idea of being a shared location for the community where food, drink and gossip simultaneously occurs, The Communal Place provides diners with the opportunity to unwind, relax and connect over delicious meals of family sized contemporary Western fusion food and great tasting cups of coffee in a relaxing environment. \r\n\r\nPlacing social interaction and the idea of family food sharing at the heart of what they do, The Communal Place takes a cue from the strong Peranakan and Eurasian heritage of the local areas and this is aptly reflected in their approach to style of food and portion. A highly recommended chef\u2019s favourite is the Miso Salmon. Served alongside glazed vegetables and mash, the fresh salmon is pan-seared to perfection, making for mouthfuls of tender and juicy meat. For the brunch lovers, the restaurant has a specially curated all day brunch menu that indulges diners in pancakes and French Toast, all day every day. \r\n\r\nBoasting spacious interiors and casual aesthetics, the restaurant is the place to be for brunch, intimate date nights or amazing celebrations. (Jan 2021)", "Clean, contemporary, and healthful. That\u2019s the philosophy underpinning the cooking at COMO Cuisine, a dining establishment that formerly existed as a pop-up but has now found a permanent home on the chic grounds of COMO Dempsey. \n\nBy drawing inspiration from the region\u2019s rich culinary heritage, the restaurant surprises and astounds with its clever use of Asian ingredients and techniques. Perennial favourites include the heaping Our Big Raw Salad, which features a guilt-free indulgence of fresh and raw fruits and vegetables. There are a number of featured dishes inspired by the Indian subcontinent, such as the crunchy Samosas stuffed with spiced lamb and topped with a sweet and tangy mango chutney. Or opt for the Lamb Kofta, which has a hint of smokiness from the tandoor that\u2019s fired by coconut charcoal. To make dining a family-friendly affair, the restaurant shies away from predictable kids\u2019 menus. Instead, COMO Cuisine encourages young diners to expand their palates by choosing any dish that is served in a smaller portion. \n\nDesigned by Italian architect and designer, Paola Navone, COMO Cuisine\u2019s decor is a stunning interplay of light and elegant elements to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. Come for the innovative food, but stay for the warm ambience and truly exceptional dining experience that makes you feel like royalty. (Aug 2017)", "", "It\u2019s easy to lose track of which bar is which amidst the slew of hotel bars in Singapore. Not so for Cook & Brew, which stands out from the rest with its vast selection of craft beers, mouthwatering nosh, and tasteful aesthetic (think dark red leather bar stools and a black marble-topped bar). The food isn\u2019t any run of the mill finger food; rather, take your pick from a range of skilfully-cooked local and international delights that will be sure to impress even the most discerning palate.\r\nKick start your meal with bar bites including Pad Thai Fries, a delicious combination of sweet potato fries tossed in a heady mix of pad thai sauce and freshly squeezed lime, adorned with chicken, prawns, crushed peanuts and dried sakura shrimps, and Whipped Buffalo Milk Ricotta, Truffle Honey and Grilled Bread \u2013 whipped to create a delicate texture and sweetened with truffle honey to complement the crusty grilled sourdough, alongside a selection of craft beers. For dessert, you definitely can\u2019t go wrong with the decadent Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch Cake.\r\nIt\u2019s hard not to have a wonderful time at Cook & Brew, with its quality eats and tipples (don\u2019t forget to make use of the beer pairing suggestions for your dish). (March 2020)", "The dim lighting and chocolate-brown leather sofas at this intimate bar sets the mood for a dram (or two) of whisky. Which, of course, is the drink du jour here at The Cooperage. You\u2019ll find usual suspects like the Macallans, Hibiki, and Nikka on the menu, as well as rare bottles such as the Bowmore Mizunara. \r\n\r\nOn the food front, tuck into canapes, donburi bowls, as well as pastas to go with your smoky spirits. The Spicy Prawn And Scallop Aglio Olio is tossed in a fiery, umami-packed oil, with plump crustaceans served with their heads on so you can suck out all the rich juices. There\u2019s also a creamy Carbonara loaded with generous slivers of fried bacon, and Salmon with Spicy Mentaiko donburi garnished with gleaming ikura pearls. For heartier mains, order the Duck Confit. The fork-tender duck with a crispy skin is swathed in orange sauce, and comes with a fragrant truffle mash and a side salad -- a generous portion that\u2019s enough for two to share. (Oct 2018)", "At Crystal Jade Jiang Nan, the food of the region south of the Yangtze River is firmly on display here. Best known for its skillfully crafted snacks and delicacies, this cuisine leans towards subtle and light flavours that will nevertheless tantalise your tastebuds.  \n\nWith bamboo shoots being one of the region\u2019s most cherished crop, it\u2019s inevitable this ingredient would make its way onto the menu. Under the deft hands of the chefs, this eatery spins this humble ingredient into culinary gold, creating dishes such as the intensely fragrant Stewed Bamboo Shoot and Deep-fried White bait in Wuxi Style. The delicious yet nutritious Double-boiled Chicken Soup is another dish that will undoubtedly impress any health-conscious diner. Meanwhile, one cannot pass up on the Crystal Jade Steamed Assorted Flavours Xiao Long Bao. These little balls of perfection come in an assortment of flavours which include salted egg yolk, chilli crab, and mushroom. For those with a sweet tooth, prepare to indulge in the many desserts that include the Pan-fried Red Bean Pancake and Osmanthus with Wolfberry Cake. \n\nThere may be no lack of Chinese food in Singapore, but for discerning foodies like us, Crystal Jade Jiang Nan holds a special place in our heart thanks to its unique regional fare and swift service. Serving up Spanish inspired fare for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, this restaurant has been a hotspot for Tanjong Pagar natives since its opening in 2006. With a bright interior and a warm atmosphere, this is the perfect place to grab drinks with friends on the weekend. With a menu inspired by the Caribbean, as well as parts of Asia and Europe, the food here draws inspiration from plenty of sources, but the combination of flavours is set to wow your tastebuds.\n\nThe Seafood Jambalaya is a unique dish native to Louisiana and made with tomato rice, parsley, mozzarella, and chilli. This hearty plate is topped with a healthy portion of tiger prawns and mussels for a rich seafood flavour. Carnivores will love the Rack Of Lamb - meat marinated with mushroom pepper sauce and served with tomatoes, asparagus, and capsicum. The lamb is tender and buttery, and the pepper marinade gives it just the right amount of spice. For a hearty meal, opt for the Chicken And Mango Salsa Wrap. The combination of sweet and savoury flavours, along with the spice in the accompanying condiments makes for a unique dish that will leave you wanting more. (Aug 2018)", "", "If you\u2019re a diner who enjoys trying the food of visiting chefs from out of town, then book your table at Curate. This RWS stalwart is helmed by resident chef Benjamin Halat, who is joined every three months by international guest chefs from Michelin-starred restaurants overseas. who create fine degustation menus together with him. \r\n\r\nChef Halat\u2019s pedigreed background means he can hold his own, too. When not joined by visiting chefs, the German native consistently turns out bold, cutting-edge European dishes. Appetisers begin on a fun note, with a picnic basket of homemade German pretzels and obatzda, camembert cheese infused with cumin and paprika. These lead the way to equally creative mains, like a smoked fish tartare with pickled daikon that is the chef\u2019s interpretation of a popular charcoal-grilled fish you\u2019ll find in the beer gardens of Bavaria in springtime. The star of the show, though, Russishes Ei. Chef Halat, turns an organic farm egg into a light and fluffy souffle texture, placing it atop a bed of potato cream and champagne foam on the side, with a dollop of Beluga caviar. It\u2019s a luxurious dish that is light as air yet tasty at the same time, and is what keeps you coming back to Curate even when there isn\u2019t a visiting chef in town. (Feb 2019)", "An exciting venture from Chef and owner Andrew Walsh, Cure Singapore on Keong Saik Road is a creative shophouse space offering a casual yet refined environment to dine, drink, and whisk the night away. \n\nIntegrating many years of his experience cooking in acclaimed Michelin star kitchens across Dublin, London and New York Chef Walsh's fervour for presenting only the finest seasonal produce, ingredients, and flavours shows in each dish presented at Cure. Unconstrained by cuisine, technique, or theme, expect to be blown away with a revolving menu, top-notch service, and unique dishes that transcend time! (Mar 2016)", "Curry Bowl is a casual diner specialising in \u2014 you guessed it \u2014 curries! A variety of vegetarian and non-vegetarian curries are served, with favourites including the Butter Chicken Masala, Paneer Tikka Masala, and Prawn Chettinad Gravy. Don't forget to order a basket of fluffy naan to soak up all the leftover gravy at the end of the meal.\r\n\r\nBesides curries, a wide range of appetisers, tandoori, rice dishes, and more are available. For something unique, try the Mutton Kola Urundai with spice-flavoured mutton meatballs, or the Honey Paneer. If you\u2019re looking for classics done right, you can\u2019t go wrong with Chicken or Mutton Biryani.\r\n\r\nWash all that spicy goodness down with an ice-cold Sweet Lassi or comforting Masala Tea. (Dec 2019)", "", "If you\u2019re a fan of mala hotpot (who isn\u2019t?), you\u2019ll want to book your seats at Da Long Yi. This Chinese export is well known for its fiery soup base, which comes with oil or butter to cut through the richness of the broth. \r\n\r\nThe food portions here are generous as well. Pick from the usual platters of US beef or wagyu, Kurobuta pork belly or loin, as well as slices of lamb. The golden straw mushrooms are a universal favourite among the selection of vegetables, along with leafy greens such as spinach or Chinese cabbage. \r\n\r\nFans of the six-second beancurd skin roll will also find this available on the menu here. Simply dip the golden beancurd roll into the soup to sop up all the flavours of the broth. Enjoy your meats and vegetables with your choice of condiments, from cut chilli to sesame oil and chopped coriander. (Oct 2019)", "With a live pasta-making station and a lively Italian wood-fired oven, dining at Da Paolo Dempsey Restaurant & Bar is a visual treat.\r\n\r\nFor lunch, pick from a selection of Italian cold cuts and cheeses, or nibble on some antipasti like fresh calamari or burrata cheese with smoked eggplant puree. Healthy eaters will also love the Wholesome Kale Bowls, topped with delicious options such as Baked Salmon and Avocado Rice, or Beef Romanesco.\r\n\r\nCome dinner, load up on freshly made pastas and pizzas. The Butternut Pumpkin Mezzelune is a vegan\u2019s dream come true, with a light cashew cream and pumpkin carpaccio piped into delicate half-moon shaped pasta. Also good is the Spicy Lobster Tagliolini, featuring slipper lobster, a sweet tomato sauce, and plenty of garlic. Fancy a pie? The 8-Cheese Pizza is a different take of the usual quattro formaggi \u2014 with twice the cheesy goodness, and some smoked date cream and truffle honey to balance out the richness.\r\n\r\nSave some space for the Tiramisu. Light, fluffy, and dusted generously with cocoa powder, this dessert is a sweet treat to be savoured at the end. (Oct 2019)", "", "", "", "Located within the heart of Singapore, Dallas Restaurant & Bar is a contemporary bar-bistro concept with outlets at two prime locations in the central business district. It is a marvel to see, with a taste that can only be described as heavenly. But burger nirvana is not only achieved with indulgent ingredients. Every element of the dish from the construction to the condiments will make you a believer in intelligent design. After all, db Bistro & Oyster Bar was established by a virtual deity in the culinary world, Chef Daniel Boulud. As such, his virtuosity is evident in each creation that leaves the kitchen.\nAnd despite its larger-than-life reputation, db Bistro & Oyster Bar manages a down-to-earth, modern bistro feel. With an updated crimson and mahogany theme and faultless service, the Bistro personifies chic French dining. The Original db Burger certainly draws the most devotees, but the comfortable dining room also hosts business gatherings, Marina Bay shoppers and Singapore visitors.\nThe menu features exquisite bistro classics - Coq Au Vin, Tartare, Oysters, Duck Confit - all done so well that it will become your new standard for future imitations. It's no wonder db Bistro & Oyster Bar is on the universal foodie bucket list, and to answer your prayers, your seat is now just a click away. (Mar 2021)", "", "Meat-lovers would be proud to call Decker Barbecue their second home. This casual, no-frills establishment located along charming Robertson Quay serves up authentic Texan-style barbecued meats that have gone through the time-honoured tradition of low and slow smoking within Decker\u2019s custom-built smoker for 16 hours. \n\nA collaboration between Club Street Social and Bali\u2019s famed Smokehouse BBQ, Decker also prides itself on quality meats at reasonable prices. Meats here are sliced to order and sold by weight, so you can have as much or as little as you like of that fall-off-the-bone goodness. Look forward to a meaty affair with Decker\u2019s delicious Brisket, Spare Ribs, Buffalo Wings, and Chopped Beef. There is no bad choice here - the perfectly smoked meats are tender, juicy, and bursting with flavour. On weekends, treat yourself with the Pork Belly Burnt Ends and the aptly-named Dinosaur Rib, a succulent 600-gram bone-in beef short rib. The sandwich combos are also worthy of mention, and our favourite has got to be the \u201cBig Daddy\u201d Fried Chicken, where a chunky piece of crispy fried chicken is piled high with slaw, jalapenos, and barbecue sauce and slapped between two plump buns.\n\nAmp up your meat order with classic all-American side dishes made in-house daily such as the Brisket Beans (barbecue baked beans and smoked brisket), mouthwatering Cornbread, and of course,  Mac \u2018N Cheese. End off with the Banana Pudding with an authentic southern dessert that we just can\u2019t get enough off. (Apr 2021)", "", "", "This classy spot in Sunshine Plaza is the first offshore outlet of the beloved cafe which has been making waves in the Japanese dining scene for nearly a decade. The dishes on offer here are based on traditional dishes from all over Japan - from Osaka to Sendai, and the menu includes classics such as Hakata Black Curry and Ox Tongue Steak Don. \n\nThe Avocado Quattro Cheese Wagyu Burger is perfect for health nuts who are looking for something moreish. The Wagyu Burger is cooked to your desired doneness, topped with creamy avocado and a decadent helping of cheese. The buns are soft, fresh and have an added crunch from the sesame toppings.\n\nThe Hakata Black Curry is a unique dish of rice, vegetables, and thick gravy. The curry is made with miso, chicken and pork broth, and spices. Mix the steamed rice that comes with this dish with the curry and vegetables provided for a dish that is filling, healthy, and flavourful. \n\nAdventurous diners can opt for the Ox Tongue Steak Don, a beloved delicacy of Sendai. The meat is grilled to perfection and is tender and juicy, which goes perfectly with the fresh steamed rice the dish comes with. (June 2018)", "For many foodies, the name Jean-Georges Vongerichten needs no introduction. Best known for his skills as a chef and restaurateur, this culinary superstar owns a deep stable of restaurants that have gathered critical accolades and Michelin stars alike. All the magic happens in its open kitchen where cooking is elevated into a performance art. Notable signature dishes made famous by Jean-Georges appear on the menu here, be it the rich Egg Caviar that\u2019s composed of a warm and oozy egg capped off with caviar and herbs, or the decadent and heavenly Black Truffle and Fontina Pizza. On a hot day, there\u2019s nothing cooler than a bowl of Tomato Gazpacho that\u2019s enhanced with a drizzle of olive oil. (Aug 2017)", "Nestled along a row of shophouses on Prinsep Street, Der Biergarten, \u2018The Beer Garden\u2019 in German, has been attracting quite the crowd for its accessible and mouthwatering German beer and dishes. Inspired by the traditional beer gardens typically found in the Bavarian region, the unassuming space is perfect for an intimate dinner or post-work drinks.\n\nTuck into German classics like the Goulasch Souppe, a luscious and nutritious beef stew served with fluffy German bread, or the traditional Sausage Platter, featuring a medley of different sausages along with the typical German sides of mashed potatoes and sauerkraut. The Roast Pork Knuckle, a famed favourite, is an oven-roasted pork hock served with dark beer gravy, mashed potatoes, and sauerkraut - a definite crowd pleaser as well. Crispy, crackling skin gives way to tender, succulent meat accentuated by the bittersweet notes of the dark beer gravy.\n\nLooking for finger food to accompany the drinks instead? Tantalising bar bites such as the Boxing Drumlet or the Deep-Fried Mushroom Fritters are the perfect partners-in-crime to traditional draft beers such as the world-famous Paulaner Original Munich Hell. If you aren\u2019t looking for a beer, a bevy of other options including an eclectic wine and cocktail list, are available as well. Guess it\u2019s time to make a trip down for a tipple or two soon! (Aug 2017)", "Nestled in the Malay enclave on Kampong Glam is the gorgeous restaurant serving up delicious Turkish dishes. With blue-tiled walls and oud music in the air, you\u2019d be forgiven for thinking you were in Ankara when you first enter this restaurant. The smell of fresh flatbread and stews, as well as the welcoming atmosphere of this restaurant make this the perfect place for a hearty meal with family and friends.\n\nThe Patlican Musakka is a classic Turkish item that is not to be missed. Made with chicken or lamb, eggplant, potato, and topped with a generous helping of cheese, this rich dish is baked in a claypot for maximum flavour. Earthy, buttery, and delectable, this is an absolute must-try for diners who are new to Turkish cuisine. If you\u2019re looking for a Turkish take on a classic dish, look no further than the Pasta Carbonara. Made with some additional herbs and spices and without the addition of bacon, this is a Middle Eastern rendition of the classic Italian dish and just as good as the original.", "A heartwarming cuisine that  fills the stomach and soul, Teochew food is the culinary balm we need on cold rainy days. And when the craving for this notable cuisine hits, there\u2019s no better place to go than Di Wei Teochew Restaurant. This humble eatery, which first opened its doors in 2014 at the Singapore Botanic Gardens, has now expanded to a grand colonial bungalow that\u2019s located in Seletar Aerospace Park. \n\nSit around one of the restaurant\u2019s round table and be amazed by the seemingly endless amounts of food that Chef Khoo Tai Guan and his team puts out. The menu at this restaurant is built around lightly-flavoured delicacies made from only the freshest ingredients the kitchen staff can buy. If you come here on any given day, don\u2019t be surprised to see dishes such as the Teochew Cold Crab, deep-fried Prawn Balls, or crispy Pork Rib Yam Rings flying out of the kitchen doors. Craving something more luxurious? Then be sure to give the Crayfish Porridge or the Pomfret Porridge a try. \n\nAt Di Wei, Chef Khoo takes the classic and cherished Teochew dishes and modernizes them for the new generation. (May 2018)", "Dian Xiao Er\u2019s decor is meant to look like one of those old-school Chinese inns you see in movies -- you know, the sort where Shaolin Warriors stop at, mid-journey, on their quest for justice and peace. Timber furniture, carved wooden screens, red cloth aplenty, you half expect an epic fight to break out in Dian Xiao Er, with kungfu kicks and wine barrels flying around.\n\nExcept the only fight one can imagine here is over the famous Herbal Roasted Duck that has been the mainstay of the Dian Xiao Er menu for the last 12 years. The dark herbal gravy that the duck comes bathed in is made of 10 Chinese herbs that include codonopsis root, foxglove root, and licorice root. This gravy is said to have a calming effect while relieving mental stress and revitalizing energy. We were definitely very energized after eating this duck, not least because of its succulence and moistness. The duck skin itself is also crispy and adds a satisfying crunch to the dish. Paired with fragrant steamed rice, the flavours of this dish are strong, but not overpowering. \n\nTry the other dishes on the menu as well; Dian Xiao Er specializes in traditional Chinese comfort food such as melt-in-the-mouth Dong Po Pork and refreshing Silver Cod Fish in Superior Soy Sauce. For a taste of traditional Chinese inn food, Dian Xiao Er is the place to go. (Sept 2016)", "Dian Xiao Er symbolizes a pit-stop for travelers (customers) to rest and replenish their energy fully before setting off to continue their hectic journeys again. Dian Xiao Er not only provides to the travelers a place of warmth, satisfaction and happiness as they indulge in the delectable dishes, it is also a place for them to interact and build relationships with one another. Dian Xiao Er also symbolizes an element of blessing and fellowship as everyone is brought together in Dian Xiao Er.\n\nThe ambience at Dian Xiao Er is intentionally planned to be rustic and raw with the careful selection of materials to complement the freshness of the herbal roast ducks which are prepared and roasted in the display kitchen daily. Customers can expect to experience a choice of dining ambience varying from dining inside a traditional Chinese inn to dining inside a rustic timber shed at the foot of a stone cliff. (Sep 2018)", "The idea of halal dim sum may be surprising to some, because really, what is dim sum without the iconic char siew bun or xiao long bao? However, The Dim Sum Place might just change your mind, with its mouth-watering array of Cantonese snacks with a local twist. In fact, with the eatery being flooded with customers every night, we dare say it's been given the Singaporean stamp of approval. \r\n\r\nThe menu features an impressive variety of dishes, including steamed, baked, and fried dim sum, noodles, seafood, and roasted meats. Their rendition of the char siew bun is a crowd favourite, with tender braised duck slathered in the same sweet and savoury sauce we all know and love. Other must-try items are the Salted Egg Custard Bun, Vermicelli Roll with Roasted Duck Cha Shu and Herbal Duck. \r\n\r\nMake sure to leave room for dessert too. From comforting yam paste to indulgent honeycomb cakes, you wouldn't want to sit this one out. \r\n\r\nOh and did we mention it opens till 5am on Fridays and Saturdays? It\u2019s definitely the perfect spot for late-night feasting with your besties. Their rendition of the char siew bun is a crowd favourite, with tender braised duck slathered in the same sweet and savoury sauce we all know and love. From comforting yam paste to indulgent honeycomb cakes, you wouldn't want to sit this one out.\r\n\r\nOh and did we mention it opens till 5am on Fridays and Saturdays? It\u2019s definitely the perfect spot for late-night feasting with your besties. (Jan 2018)", "We believe all good things come from the earth. The gut-pleasing grapes and grains free of nasty chemicals. (Apr 2021)", "With noted New York restaurants popping up all over Singapore, it\u2019s quickly beginning to feel like the city is turning into a satellite state of the Big Apple. But with nightlife legends like Employees Only leading the charge, there\u2019s very little to complain about. Loved by night owls in New York for its kooky, offbeat service, strong classic cocktails, and delicious comfort food, this West Village institution is now in Singapore, headed by one of the original bosses, the affable Igor Hadzismajlovic. Employees Only\u2019s Singapore outpost is the bar\u2019s first such international undertaking, and has landed at swish Amoy Street, to join the belt-of-sin\u2019s constellation of upmarket speakeasies.\nPast the friendly door-keeps, you\u2019re greeted by a surly, turban-wearing fortune teller (don\u2019t ask) before you go through velvet curtains into a Moulin-Rouge-esque carnival of raucous chatter, Motown, and the chaotic sounds of a busy bar. The crowd is one of the friendliest in town, standing-room only on the best of nights with plenty of good booze to keep conversations going. Sip on one of the bar\u2019s superb classic Manhattans as you scoot over to your table and sit down to a supper of comforting favourites like the joint\u2019s famous Bone Marrow Poppers and Hand Cut Steak Tartare. Earlier in the night, dinner plates include a Roasted Half Chicken adorned with cauliflower, capers, and parsley, a tender Porterhouse Pork Chop with black eyed peas and savoy cabbage, and a grilled Whole Rainbow Trout.\nBut with accolades including Spirited Awards\u2019 \u201cWorld\u2019s Best Cocktail Bar\u201d, Employees Only Singapore guides your focus to the well trained bar-team, led by veteran bartender Steve Schneider, which turns out classic cocktails and new signatures made from a hefty selection of boutique spirits, house-made syrups, tinctures, and other goodies. Employees Only is all good: the vibes, the food, the drink, and, employees or not, we\u2019re glad it\u2019s in Singapore! (Jan 2017)", "The Priv\u00e9 Group's first foray into Chinese cuisine, EMPRESS snags a prime spot in the Asian Civilisations Museum. Offering up waterfront dining, the restaurant boasts an excellent view of the Singapore River. A theme of mixing old and new flows throughout the restaurant and nicely echoes the design philosophy of the museum. It's contemporary interior and vibrant d\u00e9cor contrasts with the colonial facade, and diners will surely enjoy the juxtaposition of casual dining whilst nestled in the confines of a formal museum.\r\nThis trend continues with the menu. EMPRESS features dishes that are a mainstay of Cantonese cuisine but does so in a way that blends good ole' Cantonese flavours with more modern touches. Don't worry, you'll still be able to recognize items from dim sum to their signature roast meats. Speaking of which, the Triple Roast Platter, which showcases Spare Ribs, Char Siew, and Roast Pork, all of which are carefully cooked to retain that perfect level of juiciness, is a team favourite! EMPRESS is also one of the first few restaurants in Singapore to give an Asian-slant to Impossible Meat \u2013 the Impossible Meat Gyozas and Kway Teow are truly delicious. EMPRESS also bucks convention with their Western-style salads and plated desserts including the decadent Sticky Date & Longan Pudding. On weekends and public holidays, EMPRESS also offers a sumptuous dim sum buffet which you can pair with champagne for an indulgent treat.\r\nAll in all, EMPRESS hopes to eradicate the notion that Cantonese cuisine can be a bit stuffy, and you'll no doubt agree once you experience the relaxed environment and accessible dishes. (Jan 2021)", "Touted to be Singapore\u2019s first \u2018restaurant with rooms\u2019, The English House is designed to give diners a taste of what it\u2019ll be like dining in the home of British legend Marco Pierre White. Lush green foliage at the entrance gives way to dimly-lit interiors decked with Terry O\u2019Neill photographs, while jazz music plays softly in the background. \r\n \r\nFrom the menu comes British classics like fish and chips and beef wellington. The former is no greasy battered fish served in a newspaper cone; instead, White brings in top-grade English turbot, lightly-battered and served with thick, golden chips cooked in beef fat. Order mains like the Grilled Rib of Black Angus Beef and the Honey Roast Belly Pork Marco Polo to share. The Honey Roast Pork Belly comes piping hot in a claypot, where four generous slabs of unctuous meat lie on a bed of fried kway teow. The smoky rice noodles, together with the marbled meat and crunchy pieces of crackling are a wonderful combination that will keep you coming back for more. \r\n\r\nSave some space for desserts \u2014 portions are dainty enough to have one all by yourself. Top picks include a wobbly English Egg Custard that tastes like a refined egg tart, or opt for a lighter dish of Champagne Poached Pear with a luscious creme vanilla. (Feb 2019)", "Located in the vintage brownstone Kam Leng Hotel on Jalan Besar, this restaurant exudes retro charm, even from the exterior. From the twinkling lights illuminating the signboard to the pop art illustrations of Chinese ladies with coiffed hair adorning the menu, stepping into this restaurant is like going back in time. The concept may be dated, but the food certainly isn\u2019t. Founded solely on the principle of enjoying life while it lasts, this spot serves up delicious nosh at an affordable price.\r\n\r\nChef-Owner Joel lives by one principle, and that is making the most of precious moments by enjoying some of the best food life has to offer. Therefore it\u2019s no surprise that the menu here consists of hearty local comfort food such as the Singapore Style Chilli Prawns, Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon, and XO White Fish Soup.\r\n\r\nThe Curry Chicken is a must-try. The chicken is cooked in a special blend of spices till it is tender enough to fall off the bone, giving the dish a richness that is reminiscent of zi char stalls in the olden days. The Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon is a great option for diners who love hawker food. Made with thin stands of vermicelli tossed in a smoky, savoury homemade sauce, and topped with a generous portion of melt-in-your-mouth braised pork, this is the perfect dish to warm you up on a cold day. Situated away from the hustle and bustle of city life, Enjoy at Stevens will spot a familiar yet modernistic experience.\r\n\r\nEstablished since 2018, Enjoy's regulars will be familiar with their hearty recipes, inherited from Chef Joel's grandma, that are zhng-ed to give a contemporary interpretation of zi char delights that come with a strong wok hei flavour.\r\n\r\nWith a new elevated menu meticulously curated by the Enjoy team, one can expect an array of quality selections exclusive to the latest flagship outlet such as the Classic Yu Sheng Ceviche, White Pepper Alaskan King Crab, Popiah Garden, and more. (Feb 2019)", "", "", "If you're a tapas lover, you've probably already met, fallen for, and likely tried to marry Esquina, a charming hole-in-the-wall restaurant wrapped around a corner of Jiak Chuan in Keong Saik. With nostalgic Spanish kitchen curios and rough-hewn textures, the final product is a modern depiction of an urban canteen in Seville.\nEsquina has seen two chef changes since its founding, but the tradition of strong flavours and Spanish flair continues on with Executive Chef Carlos Montobbio. Born in Barcelona, the 28 year old has over ten years of experience despite his youth, including time spent in Michelin-starred restaurants, which accounts for the sophistication of the food and plating.\nWhile the second storey offers a quieter and equally quaint setting, you might prefer to sit around the frenetic open kitchen on the ground floor to marvel at the works of art being created not two feet away. Perfectly tender Grilled Spanish Octopus, the deceptively plain-sounding Spanish Omelette, and more unique Wagyu Beef Intercostals are just a few of the delicious plates you can find on the six-sectioned menu. The tiny digs may leave you without a seat if you haven't made a reservation, but Esquina is definitely worth the wait. (Aug 2018)", "Restaurant Euphoria is the showcase for Gastro-Botanica, the culinary philosophy by celebrated chef Jason Tan.  The name \u2018Euphoria\u2019 and the Chinese character \u2018\u5fc6\u2019 in the logo convey the promise of delight, wonderment, and enduring memory awaiting the diner. With Restaurant Euphoria, Chef Jason introduces Gastro-Botanica 2.0,  the elevated iteration of his original cuisine that showcases carefully sourced and prepared premium vegetables, meats and seafood, where prominence and elaboration are given to botanical elements of vegetables, tubers, herbs, spices, and fruits. \n\r\nVersion 2.0 introduces botanical essences to create base sauces known as Gastro-Botanica Essences \u2013 La Symphonie de L\u00e9gumes. In doing so, Chef Jason radically departs from the foundational \u2018mother sauces\u2019 of French haute cuisine, thus blazing the trail for further innovation. (Feb 2021)", "Chilli crab and Hainanese chicken rice have become the hallmark of Singaporean-Chinese cuisine. (May 2014)", "", "", "Like a magician with a particular flair for showmanship, Spanish maestro Nandu Jubany of Michelin-starred Can Jubany fame, produces a gastronomical spectacular of sorts, cloaked by the industrial facades of Hong Kong Street.\nWith his lovely assistants Jordi Noguera of Foodbar Dada lineage, and Dario Nocentini plucked from the Catalunya bar, Jubany conducts quite a show of Spanish culinary arts. The restaurant has just the fitting look, with zany motifs reminiscent of Picasso, materialized as if from a dreamscape. Pepper grinder light fixtures and super-sized sculptures of familiar faces float above the dining space. A vintage motorcycle adorns the walls, and the food too has a quirky appearance that eclipses the unexpectedly classic flavours. Jubany introduces Catalan folk cuisine, and with a wave of the wand, adds brilliant Asian twists.\nThe black Mediterranean paella is filling yet nuanced in taste, and the patatas bravas and tomato bread both show a different side of the traditional tapas dishes. On the more Asian end of the spectrum, the Thai razor clams are delightfully piquant, while the roasted duck with orange zest dumplings show the chef's hubris in remaking local favourites. The varied menu even includes gluten-free options like the chocolate hamburger, a dessert indicative of the humourous approach FOC takes to dining.\nFrom the bar, brilliantly innovative cocktails are not in short supply. The menu is a clear demonstration of Nocentini's flexing of his creative muscles, using such unique ingredients as Matcha powder, cornflakes vodka, and galangal rum (though not all in the same drink).\nIf the name of the restaurant sounds like the slip of the tongue could be a dangerous one, it\u2019s not an unintentional coincidence. Meaning fire in Catalan, FOC certainly plays with fire both in its name, its daring dishes, and its unapologetically unconventional approach to nouveau dining. (Jun 2019)", "", "", "High ceilings and a lush rainforest-themed decor make dining at Forest a serene experience. Try the Textures of Black Sesame, a molten lava cake with a nutty sesame filling. Alternatively, the ingredients can be boiled but, if you\u2019d like to have your calories and eat healthy too, stick to deep frying and add a portion of vegetables instead.\nMid-afternoon is when the yong tau foo disappears but their Asian-inspired tapas won\u2019t leave you missing it too much. (Nov 2017)", "Since 1999, G7 Sin Ma Live Seafood and Frog Porridge has been on a mission to provide the best frog leg porridge in Singapore. From its first humble bowl of porridge, it has expanded its menu to include premium live seafood and various zi char dishes. \r\n\r\nA good frog leg porridge is a foodie's dream, with tender chunks of meat marinated in a savoury combination of soy sauce, spring onions and spices, accompanied by a starchy bowl of rice congee to balance out the flavours. It's no wonder that it's been ranked highly in Singapore's list of comfort foods. The one at G7 is even cooked the traditional way, in a clay pot to preserve its taste and nutritional benefits. \r\n\r\nWhile you might have come for the iconic dish, you won't be able to resist trying other highlights like the Chilli Crab, Drunken Prawns, Bamboo Clams and Marmite Pork Ribs. (Sep 2018)", "A place where health and wealth align, nourish your body with whole foods that are as close to nature as it is intended to be with low human interference. Genius Central Singapore is a place for entrepreneurs, change-makers, health-conscious and digital nomads. This restaurant caters to gluten-free, dairy-free, vegan, vegetarian, egg-free, and nut-free options.\r\n\r\nHeaded by Chef Ilham Tahirov, a renowned figure in the whole foods scene, Genius Central Singapore\u2019s culinary team is dedicated to preparing meals that are delicious, healthy, and most importantly, house-made. We take pride in creating food items in-house, from our sauces to raw desserts to locally-farmed produce. This goes the same for our meat options, where we ensure that we only serve high-quality organic chicken; prawns, and fish wild-caught, that is, they are caught in their natural environment by fishermen. Ingredients such as organic basmati rice, gluten-free soy sauce, wolfberry, haricot fine beans, and gluten-free batter can be found in the extensive menu.\r\n\r\nTo get your day started for breakfast, start with a Smoothie Bowl or our famous Smashed Avocado, a healthy breakfast seasoned in Himalayan pink salt that sits on a 36-hour fermented toast, sprinkled with house-made dukkah and balsamic glaze, and topped with a chunky tomato salad and fresh herbs. For lunch, our popular Falafel bowl from the Longevity Bowls section makes a great lunch option. It is filled with a variety of mixed mesclun, cherry tomato salsa, tabouleh, traditional hummus, beetroot hummus, house-made falafel, mixed herbs, avocado, house-made plant-based raita, house-made flatbread, dukkah. Looking for something to fill your tummy after a long day? Genius Central also has you covered. Mains include the Creamy Mushroom Pasta, a healthier version to the traditional Italian favorite, a dish which Genius Central uses cashew milk to create the creamy texture.  Guests can also opt for gluten-free pasta. Khichdi is something that will fill your belly, with yellow mung lentils and plant-based raita cooked together with organic basmati rice. Genius Central Singapore\u2019s menu also extends to desserts. Indulge your sweet tooth with raw bars such as the Cranberry Slice, Peanut Butter Slice, as well as options like the Vegan Chocolate Mudcake and Vegan Chocolate Cake.\r\n\r\nWith ample electrical outlets and table space, the restaurant is uniquely designed to accommodate any party size of guests. Providing quality food and drinks at an affordable price, the restaurant whips up mouthwatering Penang Tze Char that perfectly complements the craft beers on offer. \r\n\r\nPromising amazing Penang seafood at incredibly low prices, relish in Penang comfort food when you head down to the restaurant. Judging by the army of loyal clientele who swear by it and visit on a regular basis, Greenwood Fish Market @ Bukit Timah can't really be considered a hidden gem. However, if you haven't heard of it before, consider yourself now in on this open secret.\nIt started originally as a fish market at 34 Greenwood Avenue with a small bistro at the back to cater to the appetite of its customers who couldn't wait to eat the day's freshest catch. It is testament to its popularity that it quickly outgrew its premises and expanded, offering a much larger dedicated dining room along with outdoor seating. Specialising in fresh seafood flown in from all over the world, daily deliveries ensure that you are getting only the best. You'll also be spoiled for choice with their truly impressive wine selection that boasts over 120 different bottles to perfectly complement any meal or budget.\nStaff are extremely friendly and knowledgeable, and always keen to recommend the freshest catch, cooked in a style that really brings out the natural flavours and textures of the fish. By taking a \"less is more\" approach, Greenwood Fish Market @ Bukit Timah lovingly showcases the freshest seafood and allows it to take center stage, where it belongs. (Oct 2011)", "Greenwood Fish Market has been an icon in the Bukit Timah neighbourhood for many years, and has since opened another outlet amidst the lush greenery of Dempsey. (Sep 2018)", "", "", "Housed on the second-story of a restored conservation shophouse in the heart of Tanjong Pagar, Group Therapy at Duxton is one of our favourite spots when we're yearning for an intimate setting with a laidback ambiance. Exuding both character and charm, with the aroma of scrumptious delights greeting diners as they enter, this is certainly the place to go when brunch is on the mind.\nWith an array of all-day breakfast offerings as well as hearty sandwiches, salads, and burgers being served up daily, let's just say that trying to decide on just one item from the menu is close to impossible. (Feb 2016)", "Slinging good old-fashioned Western style - well, grub - with a thoughtful approach to local ingredients, it may surprise you to learn that GRUB's less about greasy fast food and more about gratifying fare.\nThe founders of GRUB set out to build a diner with inspired, responsible and delicious food. And though many restaurants start out with such good-hearted intentions - recalling sustainable sourcing, organic harvesting, and no artificial preserving - the results are often less satisfactory to both the palate and wallet. Based on the buzz generated by GRUB since opening, and its bubbling-over space located off the beaten path in Bishan Park however, GRUB has nailed it. The window-encased space lends an eco-friendly vibe to the otherwise urban-hip decor. The mingling of hungry diners with park goers on the al fresco patio is the vision of peace, love and good eats.\nAnd quite tasty eats they are. The lion's share of the menu is dedicated to burgers of every sort - typical grub if there was one. Beef burgers are made from 100% grass-fed hormone-free beef, which is freshly ground in-house, a distinction you can taste in the moisture content and firmness of the patties. The juicy chicken burgers use antibiotic-free poultry as well. For vegetarians, the Portobello Burger subs the patty for a meaty mushroom cap topped with creamy crumbled feta, fresh lettuce and tomatoes. The combination is simplistic and satisfying.\nOf the signature dishes, the Mentaiko Fries are a must-try, featuring crispy shoestring fries crowned with marinated roe of pollock, and sprinkled with confetti of nori seaweed for a umami textural play that's truly unique. Another play on trendy Japanese flavours of the moment is the Sakura Ebi Linguine with crispy fried Sakura Ebi, tiger prawns and a hint of mentaiko. (Feb 2019)", "", "", "Perhaps more legend attends to the infamous puffer fish (\u2018fugu\u2019 in Japanese) than any other edible marine creature: tales of venom, stings, and the brave chefs who train for years before they are allowed to prepare this fish for customers hungry for its rich, bouncy flesh, and bragging rights. Here at Guenpin Fugu Restaurant, a Singapore outpost of the popular Japanese franchise, puffer fish is the name of the game, and it is the crowning highlight of the menu here. Whether in thick, raw slices of sashimi or sushi, lightly battered and served fried, or served in meaty chunks ready for cooking in a flavourful dashi hotpot, just about any method of cooking and eating this delicate fish is available here. One popular option is to have the meaty fish brewed with a light porridge, the perfect premium comfort food. Even the skin, lightly parboiled, is served, sashimi-style, with a zesty ponzu sauce. The puffer fish shares star billing with other premium seafood here: fleshy snow crab claws are served cold, cooked tempura-style, grilled, or hot-pot style. This is a rare treat made readily available, so grab a booking now! (Nov 2018)", "Pure creamy and melt-in-your-mouth indulgence. And no, we\u2019re not talking about ice cream here. The Gyu Bar brings in one of the rarest wagyu in town \u2014 Wa-OH beef from the Kumamoto prefecture on Kyushu Island. If you\u2019re wondering why this matters, imagine this: the super fresh air and pure, pristine waters make the perfect environment for grazing cows. The meat here is also extra-tender, thanks to a special blend of feed given to the animals. At Gyu Bar, you\u2019ll find some surprising cuts as well as the usual ribeye and sirloin fillets. Try the tomo-sankaku (a cut near the bottom round). A considerably rare cut, the glistening meat is juicy and buttery, served with a crusty sear. A little dab of wasabi helps balance out the fattiness of the meat. There\u2019s also shin-tama, which comes from the knuckle, as well as leaner cuts like short plate. While this is a reference to the world-famous Ginger Garden of the Singapore Botanic Gardens where the restaurant is located, the word itself has long been synonymous with comfort for many -- ginger tea, ginger massages. And if comfort is what you are looking for after a hard day at work or a long afternoon of relentless shopping, The Halia is the ideal place for you to kick back and relax in style.\nIn the historic UNESCO World Heritage Site that is the Singapore Botanic Gardens, The Halia is an inviting space with lush foliage complemented by wood-carved tables and open verandas. This matches the menu well, as modern European cuisine with touches of Asian influences are on offer. Favourites include the Halia Chilli Crab Spaghettini and the Sticky Toffee Pudding with Butterscotch and Vanilla Ice Cream, so be sure to try them. The piquant flavours of the former ensure that you get a taste of one of Singapore\u2019s most beloved dishes, while keeping your hands clean, and the latter is a throwback to a more decadent colonial past.\nIn keeping with the name, ginger is very much on the menu, with the irreplaceable underground root used in main courses, salads and drinks. The health benefits of ginger are multifold, from relieving digestive problems such as nausea to aiding the loss of appetite, motion sickness, and pain. It certainly is comforting to have all these great upsides in mind as you sip a ginger-infused cocktail, take in the luxuriant foliage, and relax in The Halia. (Mar 2017)", "Looking to be the most authentic traditional Korean barbeque restaurant in Singapore, HANJIP Korean Grill House is one of the biggest Korean barbeque restaurants in Singapore. Well-known for its extensive range of aged Australian Wagyu, USDA Prime Beef, as well as Kurobuta Berkshire Pork, the restaurant offers as many as seven different curated themed private dining rooms to elevate your dining experience. Be prepared for an ultimate grilling experience like no other, with top notch service provided by the attentive wait staff.\r\n\r\nHANJIP Korean Grill House aims to bring the distinguished taste of Korean barbeque to your tables with its delicious menu offerings. Start your meal with a thick slab of rich Australian Wagyu. Succulent and juicy, the beautiful marbling gives the tender steak a melt-in-your mouth texture that you\u2019ll never forget. Choose to go with a piece of Wagyu Striploin or a Wagyu Brisket for a yummy experience.\r\n\r\nFor those with a lighter palate, meat lovers can also look to satisfy their meat cravings with the Pork Belly, Pork Jowl or Pork Collar options. Complete your meal with a serving of Spicy Chicken Feet for an authentic Korean barbeque experience. (Jan 2021)", "Located in the heart of the trendiest entertainment district of Singapore, Hannibal European Grill and Bar is the perfect place for young professionals looking for a casual and laid back evening in town. With a selection of gourmet delights ranging from hamburgers, steaks, and meat skewers to thin-crust pizzas and Italian egg-based pastas, the bar attracts a cosmopolitan crowd of expats, locals, and fashionable night owls. \r\n\r\nThe Cold Cuts Platter is a great way to kickstart your meal. Featuring parma ham, mortadella, salami, mixed vegetables and eggs, this tapas item is a simple, crowd-pleasing spread to share with family and friends. An innovative offering, the Bacon Cheese Rolls are made of crisp fried bacon stuffed with mozzarella and pistachio cream that gives a satisfying crunch when you bite into the rolls of cheesy goodness. Order the Risotto Seafood to savour tasty creamy rice mixed with seafood in a light tomato sauce. Other delectable options include the Beef Lasagna and Spring Chicken. \r\n\r\nSatisfy your carnivorous cravings with the plethora of charcoal grill options available at Hannibal European Grill and Bar. Take your pick of kebabs, burger, skewers or sausages for a hearty feast. (Sep 2020)", "Hailing from Germany, this popular burger eatery has set up shop at Boat Quay, tantalising famished diners with its amazingly solid burgers, salads, and ice-cold cocktails. \n\nAt this burger bar, drool-worthy burgers is the name of the game. Depending on your preference, they come plated on sourdough or multigrain buns. Not a fan of bread? Then go for the low-carb \u201cnaked\u201d burger where your buns are substituted with lettuce and vegetables. A number of interesting ingredients span the menu so you won\u2019t see a boring run-of-the-mill cheeseburger here. We\u2019re especially fond of the ELS\u00c4SSER Burger, which comes topped with brie and cranberries. Vegetarians and vegans won\u2019t feel left out either, as this burger joint spins up a jaw-droppingly wide array of burgers well suited for every eater. One vegetarian favourite is the WOHLFEIN Burger, comprising a walnut patty, aged cheddar cheese, cranberries, and stuffed with more walnuts. Then wash down your burger bites with a cocktail or two, including the LEICHTSINN cocktail concocted from a intoxicating blend of Baileys, Amaretto, and raspberry. \n\nToss away your stereotypical notions of German food, because HANS IM GL\u00dcCK takes the standard American burger and gives it a finely-crafted German twist. (May 2018)", "Stepping into Hans Im Gluck might feel like you\u2019ve been transported into a German fairytale forest. You\u2019ll spot a rustic Bavarian alps cottage at the entrance, whimsical wooden swing sets, and idyllic alpine landscape views from the windows. And if you\u2019ve ever wondered how the Germans cook their burgers, you\u2019ll find out here at Hans Im Gluck. On the menu is an extensive selection of burgers that span beef, chicken, vegetarian and vegan. A popular favourite is the Birkenwald, a combination of mushrooms and sour cream-scallion sauce. The Horntrager is a good way to show off how delicious going vegetarian can be, with a walnut pattie topped with crumbly feta cheese and a sweet fig jam. There\u2019s a choice of sourdough or multigrain for buns, or you could go completely naked \u2014 with patties wrapped in lettuce and lots of salads. (Dec 2018)", "Stepping into Hans Im Gluck might feel like you\u2019ve been transported into a German fairytale forest. You\u2019ll spot a rustic Bavarian alps cottage at the entrance, whimsical wooden swing sets, and idyllic alpine landscape views from the windows. And if you\u2019ve ever wondered how the Germans cook their burgers, you\u2019ll find out here at Hans Im Gluck. The Horntrager is a good way to show off how delicious going vegetarian can be, with a walnut pattie topped with crumbly feta cheese and a sweet fig jam. There\u2019s a choice of sourdough or multigrain for buns, or you could go completely naked \u2014 with patties wrapped in lettuce and lots of salads. (Dec 2018)", "With origins as a seafood distributor, you can trust that Happy Dining Seafood \u559c\u6765\u805a\u6d77\u9c9c knows how to do seafood. Chinese seafood, in particular, with dishes that can be traced back to the Dongbei region of Northeast China. An underrated regional cuisine, it can be characterised by its use of pickled cabbage, potatoes, carrots, as well as wheat and corn instead of rice.The folks at this Chinese and seafood restaurant use fresh ingredients each time, offering an array of shellfish, fish, meat and vegetable dishes. Diners choose how they\u2019d like their seafood to be prepared, and which sauce or broth to accompany \u2014 whether it\u2019s 'hot & spicy', 13 spices, garlic or black pepper. Great for friends and families to share, the Seafood Platter is a mammoth creation, offering your favourite seafood staples in one set. The Baby Lobster is a juicy bite, while the Sea Bass in Soy Sauce tastes like something closer to home.Meat lovers can enjoy the spoils too, with Smoked Pork and Braised Pork Ear as some of the restaurant\u2019s favourites. (Feb 2020)", "This gem of a London export needs no real introduction. The international franchise brings its brand of hard-pumping rock music, hearty food, strong booze, and top-notch entertainment everywhere it goes. This Singapore outpost, established in 1990, has the added advantage of being somewhat of an institution amongst late-night revelers at the lively Cuscaden area, a mix of interesting characters, a diverse mix of folks from die-hard rockers to curious tourists, all seeking the restaurant-bar's hearty food, hard-rocking local bands, and the raunchy humour of its resident standup comics.\nThe memorabilia is what keeps the Hard Rock family united across the world, but put that aside for a second and consider the grub. Think American dive bar with a little upmarket touch: chicken tenders in a smoky glaze of hickory barbecue sauce and honey mustard, buffalo-style wings in a piquant dry rub served with the customary blue cheese and celery, and the franchise's famous fajitas filled with your choice of grilled meat, tangy pico de gallo, and melty cheese. For something heftier, there's also grilled steaks and a selection of meats from the smokehouse, think massive pork ribs and beef brisket in a tangy, hickory-spiked barbecue sauce. Good food, good times, and good music have always been part of the Hard Rock promise, and at this grand old dame of the late-night Orchard scene, the party never stops. (Dec 2016)", "Located at Resorts World Sentosa, Hard Rock Cafe boasts a world-famous American menu that offers the best American bites with a mix of regional favourites.\r\n\r\nFor starters, dig into the restaurant\u2019s signature slow roasted wings tossed in classic buffalo or barbeque sauce. Whipped up with carrots, celery, and blue cheese dressing, each mouthful of tender, juicy chicken packs a punch of flavours. For those who love their chips, the Classic Nachos will definitely satisfy your cravings. Layered with ranch style beans and a four cheese sauce blend, dip the crispy tortilla chips into the cheesy mess for a delicious time! \r\n\r\nDon\u2019t leave without taking a bite out of the burger that started it all. Featuring applewood bacon, cheddar cheese, crispy onion ring, leaf lettuce and vine-ripened tomato, the Original Legendary Burger is set to wow you in both size and taste. The Impossible Burger is an equally tasty rendition of the legendary steak burgers which are vegan friendly. 100% plant based, the burger is served with fresh toasted buns and a generous side of fries for an indulgent meal. \r\n\r\nEnd off your meal the American meal with a decadent slice of New York Cheesecake. (Sep 2020)", "There\u2019s something relaxing about hanging out in a bar, listening to the soulful voice of a singer on stage washing your workday blues away. At Harry\u2019s, the music is always on point and the food\u2019s always comforting. \r\n\r\nLaksa Popcorn Chicken, for instance, will win the hearts of all fried chicken fans. The crispy golden-brown nuggets of fried chicken are accompanied by a slightly spicy, piquant laksa mayonnaise that is so tasty, you might be forgiven for double-dipping. Keeping to the local trend, the Otah Toasties are also perfect beer snacks \u2014 the spicy fish paste is fragrant and generous, sandwiched between generously buttered slices of grilled toast. \r\n\r\nIf you\u2019re looking for a proper dinner, the Beer Battered Fish & Chips is a classic. Served with mushy peas and spiced fries, the chunky fillets of white fish are dipped in a light beer batter and fried to perfection. Also good is the Curried Lamb Shank or tender Beef Rendang, served with fragrant basmati rice. Wash it down with a pint of icy cold beer or a glass of wine. Keeping to the local trend, the Otah Toasties are also perfect beer snacks \u2014 the spicy fish paste is fragrant and generous, sandwiched between generously buttered slices of grilled toast. \r\n\r\nIf you\u2019re looking for a proper dinner, the Beer Battered Fish & Chips is a classic. Served with mushy peas and spiced fries, the chunky fillets of white fish are dipped in a light beer batter and fried to perfection. Also good is the Curried Lamb Shank or tender Beef Rendang, served with fragrant basmati rice. Wash it down with a pint of icy cold beer or a glass of wine. (Oct 2019)", "There\u2019s something relaxing about hanging out in a bar, listening to the soulful voice of a singer on stage washing your workday blues away. At Harry\u2019s, the music is always on point and the food\u2019s always comforting.\r\n\r\nLaksa Popcorn Chicken, for instance, will win the hearts of all fried chicken fans. The crispy golden-brown nuggets of fried chicken are accompanied by a slightly spicy, piquant laksa mayonnaise that is so tasty, you might be forgiven for double-dipping. Keeping to the local trend, the Otah Toasties are also perfect beer snacks \u2014 the spicy fish paste is fragrant and generous, sandwiched between generously buttered slices of grilled toast.\r\n\r\nIf you\u2019re looking for a proper dinner, the Beer Battered Fish & Chips is a classic. Also good is the Curried Lamb Shank or tender Beef Rendang, served with fragrant basmati rice. Wash it down with a pint of icy cold beer or a glass of wine. (Oct 2019)", "Hathaway is a restaurant in Dempsey that brings together the diverse Singaporean identity to your table. Presenting the best memories around taste and embracing the new food culture and sensibilities of the modern generation, Hathaway is great for both lunch or dinner.\r\n\r\nFor a catch up with friends, Hathaway\u2019s brunch menu offers a plethora of delightful options. If you\u2019re feeling peckish, the Pengat Pisang French Toast is a great dish to go for. Featuring caramelised bananas stewed in fragrant coconut milk, the slices of deliciously toasted bread are topped off with a generous scoop of Apom Berkuah Ice Cream for the ultimate indulgence.\r\n\r\nFor those with a hearty appetite, Hathaway\u2019s Big Breakfast will surely satisfy you. With homemade chicken sausage, smoked beef brisket, potato latkes and kacang pool, there\u2019s no lack of flavour on this platter of decadent brunch delights. Seafood lovers should definitely opt for the Octopus Bakar & Sambal Udang. Served with charred polenta and coriander lime relish, the grilled octopus is enhanced by the spiciness of the sambal udang and makes for a deliciously fiery dish. (Oct 2020)", "Inspired by Hong Kong-style cafe staples, Japanese street fair as well as Western classics, HaveFun Kitchen brings together a plethora of internationally well-loved dishes that will delight all foodies. Affordable, accessible and fun, the bistro is a great place for gatherings over food with family and friends in the heartlands up north. \r\n\r\nA delicious fusion of Cantonese fare with your favourite Western dish, the HK Style Cheese Baked Pork Rice delights your tastebuds with a mouthful of cheesy goodness and tender pork atop a bed of soft, fluffy rice. Made for seafood lovers, the HK Style Cheese Baked Seafood Rice is an equally yummy rendition of the restaurant's signature cheese baked rice. Noodle fans simply cannot leave without trying the HK Style Wonton Dry Noodles with Char Siew. Japanese sides are also available on the bistro\u2019s extensive menu. Bite into Japanese Takoyaki Balls or Breaded Prawns for a taste of Japan in HaveFun Kitchen. (Mar 2021)", "Located just a short walk from Bendemeer MRT station, they\u2019ve already gained a loyal following within weeks of opening, and it\u2019s easy to see why.  Diners can sit back, relax, and unwind at this breezy bistro on Jalan Besar. Touting itself as an oasis for stressed city-folk, Haven Bistro serves up exciting Euro-Asian fusion fare at affordable prices. Forget overpriced eggs benedict and smoothies. Haven Bistro is redefining what it means to \u201cbrunch\u201d, one plate at a time. \r\n\r\nThe Haven\u2019s Club is a signature sandwich and a must-try for first time visitors. Made with a slab of grilled chicken, tomato, lettuce, cheese, and egg, this dish is generously portioned and loaded with healthy ingredients, so it\u2019s perfect even for guests who are watching their waistlines. The adorably named Crabby Wabby is another great option for when a sandwich won\u2019t cut it. Made with perfectly al dente spaghetti and soft-shell crab, the flavours of the ingredients meld perfectly together. Craving something classic? The Piquant Fisc is right up your alley. Made with steamed rice and sambal fish, it\u2019ll make you reminiscent of the simple times. The humble combination of fiery sambal and rice is an ode to the flavours of Singaporean cuisine. (Feb 2021)", "Helmed by seasoned Japanese chef Mamoru, Hibachi offers delectable Japanese cuisine alongside alluring drinks and impeccable service. Having dedicated his whole life to achieving culinary prowess, chef Mamoru is an expert in dishing up elegant Japanese classics. Exuding Japanese modernity charm, Hibachi invites diners in for a gastronomic experience with its Kappo and Izakaya style food. With a team made up of veteran chefs Rick Chen and Leon Lim, Hibachi boasts a team with a combination of over 40 years of experience and knowledge in Japanese culinary. \r\n\r\nSavour lightly grilled meats and freshly flown in produce straight from the land of the rising sun. Grilled over warm chargill fire, meat lovers can seek to satisfy their carnivorous cravings here at Hibachi. Pair these mouthwatering menu options with the restaurant\u2019s specially selected range of fine Sake, Shochu, wines and liquors for an authentic Japanese dining experience. \r\n\r\nDon\u2019t forget to end your meal on a sweet note with the restaurant\u2019s specially curated desserts that boasts a touch of Japanese and French flair. Drop by Orchard Road today to discover this hidden gem and uncover the exquisite taste of Japan. (Apr 2021)", "", "Tucked away on Jalan Pemimpin lies The Hideout at District 20, a secluded bistro where you\u2019re invited to let your hair down and put your feet up while relaxing over a pint of ice-cold beer or a plate of nosh. \n \nDecked out in leather sofas and a towering wall of liquor, this eatery has successfully created an environment that feels more like a good friend\u2019s hangout nook. This is especially true on nights where the live music is played or English football is televised on the large screens, drawing a buzzy crowd of people who are just one conversation away from becoming your new friends. \n \nThen tuck into the restaurant\u2019s extensive menu which spans a collection of burgers, bar bites, grilled meats, pasta, and even Japanese bento boxes. (Jun 2018)", "Marbled slabs of pork belly or premium beef cuts are usually the meats of choice at most Japanese BBQ restaurants. But over at The Hitsuji Club, it's all about lamb in varying cuts. This intimate 20-seater specialises in jingisukan, a popular Hokkaido dish where mutton is grilled over a skillet. The chef\u2019s insistence to use only grain-fed, chilled baby lamb from Australia or New Zealand means you don\u2019t get the gamey smell so often associated with this meat. Instead, the grilled lamb chops are juicy and tender, with a clean, milky taste. \r\n\r\nTry the specialty Jingisukan With Lamb Chop set, which comes with different cuts such as the fillet, loin, and chops. Grilled together with plump mushrooms and fresh vegetables for an added crunch, the set can be considered a delicious and satisfying meal on its own. If you\u2019re still feeling a tad peckish, add on some cheese miso and lotus root chips for nibbles. (Mar 2019)", "", "There\u2019s an exquisite simplicity to the menu here, but be warned: if you cannot eat crab, just go somewhere else. Basically, you order a crab done in one of their six styles, and have them with some carbs. The carbs are amazing though: think heavenly, lard-and-seafood kissed, wok-breath infused Hokkien Mee, a fine Bee Hoon steeped in a rich clam broth, or the HolyCrab Fried Rice stirred up with flecks of crab meat. But all this is only accessory to the real deal: massive crabs cooked in rich sauces. The signature item is the Holy Crab, an angelic vision featuring a Crab cooked in a rich crab broth, with lots of vermicelli to soak up the goodness. Then there\u2019s the Orgasmic Crab, with a little sin injected by way of a salted egg & curry leaf gravy that is the perfect foil for sweet bouncy crabmeat. For something with more unusual twist, there\u2019s the Balsamic Crab, with the meaty crustaceans bathed in a pungent, sweet, and acidic sauce made with balsamic vinegar, fresh herbs, and spices. Then there\u2019s the house version of Singapore\u2019s national dish: Singapore Chili Crab, and there are five levels of spiciness you can choose from, one for each decade of our independence. If you\u2019re feeling a little crabbed out, throw in some decorative Seasonal Vegetables, or better yet, carb out some more with an order of fried Mantou buns to soak up all that sauce with. Don\u2019t tell your cardiologist. (Jun 2017)", "From its humble beginnings at Yio Chu Kang in 2008 to its present day expansion to Joo Chiat, Home of Seafood has been winning numerous awards for their aromatic seafood. Recipients of \"Singapore's Favourite Food\" in 2013, and also voted the \"Best Pepper Crab in Singapore\", it's clear that diners love the restaurant's ability to serve that perfect pincer.\nOne taste of their famous signature Black Pepper Crab and you'll be in love too! Their use of a milder pepper gives just enough heat to allow the sweetness of the ocean-fresh Sri Lankan crab to really come through, and often means you'll be down two claws before you've even realised how much you've eaten!\nThese capable culinary captains of crustaceans are capable of more than just that though. At Home of Seafood, you have the option of having your crab steamed, buttered, chilled, cocktail-ed, claypot-ted, or spiced up with chilli. Our personal favourite of the lot? The Salted Egg Crab. Salty, sweet, savoury, and velvety smooth, their version of this increasingly popular dish has us wondering if the days of Chili Crab as the ambassador of Singaporean cuisine might indeed be limited.\nSo whether you vote chili, pepper, or salted egg, rest assured that you've got a home away from home nestled in the increasingly hip neighbourhood of Joo Chiat. The Pork Ribs Yunnan Noodles Soup is a healthier dish that includes sweet corn, leafy vegetables and braised pieces of pork ribs. Also available with beef, these noodle options are delicious and nourishing.  \r\n\r\n \r\n\r\nThe star of the show is none other than the Cross Bridge Vermicelli. Double boiled for hours with selected duck, chicken and pork parts, the broth is extremely flavourful. Tuck in while it\u2019s boiling hot to enjoy! (Sep 2020)", "", "The Capitol Arcade location is perhaps Hopscotch\u2019s most iconic home so far. Located right outside the historic Capitol Theatre, Hopscotch once again finds itself close to the arts \u2013 a place with almost a century worth. After its revamp in 2015, the immediate area surrounding Capitol Theatre was transformed into the picturesque sunlit atrium where Hopscotch (Capitol) nests at today, \u201cArcade @ The Capitol Kempinski\u201d.The fully air-conditioned atrium exudes old world charm reminiscent of Colonial era streets with modern expression, a fascinating amalgamation of the old and new. Being located at City hall also offers much accessibility, a convenience that our original 28 Maxwell location once had. To us, this is the perfect space for merry men, lively crowds, and vibrant atmosphere, the perfect place to host guests. (Mar 2021)", "Gillman Barracks is already famed in the local art scene for its unique collection of restaurants, art galleries, and bars. Hopscotch adds to the mix by offering a selection of unique cocktails and libations for adventurous barflies. You can easily spot the bar due to its unique red brick exterior, decorative gears, and exposed piping on the outer walls. \r\n\r\nThe highlight of the menu would has to be the bespoke cocktails. Crafted with a local palate in mind, many of the drinks combine familiar flavours with exquisite liqueurs to create unique concoctions. The White Sands cocktail, for example, will have you longing for warm beach days. Served in a seashell and made with a heady mix of Kwai Feh lychee liqueur, Nigori Sake, and a coconut sorbet for some extra sweetness, this is the perfect pick-me-up drink for those sweltering days you\u2019d rather be by the sea. Pace yourself with the alcohol by indulging in some bar bites, like the Hyogo Oysters. Reasonably priced and specially flown in from the Hyogo Prefecture in Japan, these plump little gems provide a briny flavour tempered by dashi to cleanse the palate and prepare it for more flavours.
